snippet: Long-term forecasts of America’s fiscal health are not reliable and should not prompt overreaction, but the need to control health care costs is clear, an economist writes.
abstract: Long-term forecasts of America’s fiscal health are not reliable and should not prompt overreaction, but the need to control health care costs is clear, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”
